items.title: Slot wijst verbeterpunt aan: 'Anders hadden we nu zes punten meer'
items.summary: Arne Slot heeft het dit seizoen allesbehalve makkelijk bij Liverpool. De onrust rondom sterspeler Mohamed Salah speelde daarin een grote rol, net als de tegenvallende prestaties van enkele recordaankopen. Slot zelf wijst echter een ander belangrijk verbeterpunt aan: standaardsituaties.

items.title: Manchester City heeft Rodri mogelijk terug tegen Nottingham Forest
items.summary: Pep Guardiola bracht vrijdag goed nieuws uit de ziekenboeg van Manchester City. De Spaanse succesmanager stelt dat Rodri mogelijk terugkeert in de wedstrijdselectie van The Citizens voor het duel met Nottingham Forest van zaterdag in de Premier League.

items.title: Arteta 'hacked off' by Rice's time-wasting red card
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has revealed he was "hacked off" by Arsenal's draw with Brighton & Hove Albionlast season but hailed his side's improved disciplinary record this term.

items.title: Slot needed to 'convince' Ekitike to reach best form
items.summary: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike's five goals in four matches suggest he is starting to get to grips with the Premier League but head coach Arne Slot admits he had to push the player to reach his current levels.

items.title: Forest's 'greatest' John Robertson dies at 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club have announced.

items.title: Arteta komt met hoopvol blessurenieuws over Havertz
items.summary: Mikel Arteta heeft hoopvol nieuws gebracht over Kai Havertz. De Duitse spits van The Gunners kampt al sinds augustus met een blessure, maar Arteta heeft bevestigd dat het een kwestie van dagen is voordat Havertz terugkeert bij de koploper van de Premier League.

items.title: Man City players 'incredibly disciplined' - Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola says his players will have remained "incredibly disciplined" during the Christmas break to meet the standards Manchester City have set.

items.title: The Jukebox Man lands thrilling King George success for Redknapp
items.summary: The Jukebox Man, carrying the colours of former Premier League manager Harry Redknapp, came out on top in an epic renewal of the Ladbrokes King George VI Chase at Kempton Park.

items.title: Rohl wants more from Rangers midfielder Raskin
items.summary: Rangers manager Danny Rohl wants more from midfielder Nicolas Raskin and has had a long conversation with the Belgium international about the required improvements.

items.title: Birmingham hit back to hold Derby as both sides finish with 10
items.summary: Jack Robinson rescued a point for Birmingham in a bad-tempered 1-1 draw against Derby which saw both teams finish with 10 men.

items.title: Sir Gino soars to Christmas Hurdle crown
items.summary: Sir Gino proved his brilliance remains very much intact with a winning return in the Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle at Kempton Park.

items.title: Arne Slot believes ‚Äòbest is yet to come‚Äô as Liverpool look to end set-piece failings
items.summary: ‚ÄòDifference between us and other teams is too small‚Äô Liverpool have conceded 11 league goals from set pieces Arne Slot has claimed Liverpool have much more to offer this season and can become the dominant team he envisaged, although only once their set-piece failings have been eradicated. Liverpool have stemmed a damaging sequence of nine losses in 12 games ‚Äì the club‚Äôs worst run in 71 years ‚Äì to climb to fifth in the Premier League, level with fourth-placed Chelsea. But Slot, who admits Liverpool‚Äôs position remains below expectations, insists he will not get carried away by an unbeaten run of six matches because the team‚Äôs performance level requires big improvement. Continue reading...

items.title: $1 tickets to NFL playoffs? Christmas has changed for Panthers
Havertz near to Arsenal return with Arteta hoping for ‚Äòdifferent dimension‚Äô in attack
items.summary: Forward underwent knee surgery in August Arteta: ‚ÄòIt will be a matter of days, not weeks‚Äô Mikel Arteta hopes Kai Havertz is ready to return from a long-term knee injury and has predicted the German will bring ‚Äúa different dimension‚Äù to Arsenal‚Äôs attack. Havertz has been sidelined since undergoing knee surgery in August and had been expected back at the start of December before a setback in his rehabilitation. The 26-year-old was Arsenal‚Äôs top scorer in the Premier League last season with nine goals despite missing several months with a hamstring issue. He was pictured training this week and Arteta revealed Havertz had been ‚Äúquite close‚Äù to being considered for the Carabao Cup quarter-final win over Crystal Palace on Tuesday.
